# Hugolify

> Hugolify is an open-source Jamstack solution for building fast, accessible, and low-carbon websites. It combines the Hugo framework with Bootstrap and includes native configuration for 7 headless CMS (including Decap CMS, CloudCannon, and Tina).

## Documentation

- [Getting Started](https://www.hugolify.io/docs/getting-started/)
  Installation guide, prerequisites, and initial project structure.
- [Blocks & UI Components](https://www.hugolify.io/docs/blocks/)
  Complete catalog and technical documentation for the 25+ modular blocks available (Hero, Grids, FAQ, etc.).
- [Shortcodes](https://www.hugolify.io/docs/shortcodes/)
  Reference for specific Hugo shortcodes included in the framework (Buttons, responsive images, etc.).
- [Partials](https://www.hugolify.io/docs/codes/partials/)
  Commons partials (carousel, image, CTA, date, map…)
- [Functions](https://www.hugolify.io/docs/codes/functions/)
  Commons functions (PrepareHTML, GetHumanPrice, GetParamsCarousel, HasMap…)
- [Content Types (Sections)](https://www.hugolify.io/docs/sections/)
  Configuration details for available content types: Blog posts, Projects, Authors, Legal pages, and more.
- [Taxonomies](https://www.hugolify.io/docs/taxonomies/)
  Configuration details for available taxonomies: Categories, Tags, etc.
- [CMS](https://www.hugolify.io/docs/cms/admin/)
  Admin for Hugolify allowing the build of the config file for different Headless (CloudCannon, Decap, Netlify, Pages, Static, Sveltia and Tina CMS)
- [Showcase](https://www.hugolify.io/docs/showcase/)
  Selection of websites built with Hugolify.

## Guides & Tutorials

- [Tutorials](https://www.hugolify.io/tutorials/)
  Step-by-step guides for specific use cases (Creating a portfolio, a blog, or a multi-site setup).

## Source Code

- [GitHub](https://github.com/hugolify/)
  All repositories of Hugolify project.
- [GitHub Template](https://github.com/hugolify/hugolify-template)
  The starter repository to launch a new Hugolify project.
- [GitHub Theme](https://github.com/hugolify/hugolify-theme)
  The main theme repository containing the framework logic.
- [GitHub Admin](https://github.com/hugolify/hugolify-admin)
  The admin repository containing the admin logic.
